trans-unit.source: Specifies the fonts used to display text in Windows display elements.
Each property of the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts> class returns a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> used to display text in a particular Windows display element, such as the title bar of a window.
These fonts reflect the current settings in Control Panel.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used to display text in the title bars of windows.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used to display text in the title bars of windows.
Gets the default font that applications can use for dialog boxes and forms.
The following table describes the value returned by the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DefaultFont%2A> property depending on the operating system and local culture.
System and/or culture
Font
Windows NT 4x, Japanese version
MS UI Gothic, 9 point
Arabic Windows
Tahoma, 8 point
Other operating system/culture
MS Shell Dlg logical font, typically Microsoft Sans Serif, 8 point
MS Shell Dlg maps to a font set in the system registry.
If the above fonts are not installed, the default font is Tahoma, 8 point.
If Tahoma, 8 point, is not installed, <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DefaultFont%2A> returns the value of the <xref:System.Drawing.FontFamily.GenericSansSerif%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Font> returned by <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DefaultFont%2A> does not change when the user is in High Contrast mode.
For a font that changes when the user is in High Contrast mode use another system font such as <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.IconTitleFont%2A>.
The default <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> of the system.
The value returned will vary depending on the user's operating system and the local culture setting of their system.
Gets a font that applications can use for dialog boxes and forms.
If the operating system is Windows 2000 or Windows XP, the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DialogFont%2A> property returns Tahoma, 8 point.
Otherwise, <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DialogFont%2A> returns the value of the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DefaultFont%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Font> returned by <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DialogFont%2A> does not change when the user is in High Contrast mode.
For a font that changes when the user is in High Contrast mode use another system font such as <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.IconTitleFont%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that can be used for dialog boxes and forms, depending on the operating system and local culture setting of the system.
Returns a font object that corresponds to the specified system font name.
The <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.GetFontByName%2A> method returns `null` if the specified name does not match a font in the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts> enumeration.
The name of the system font you need a font object for.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> if the specified name matches a value in <xref href="System.Drawing.SystemFonts"></xref>; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used for icon titles.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used for icon titles.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used for menus.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used for menus.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used for message boxes.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used for message boxes
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used to display text in the title bars of small windows, such as tool windows.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used to display text in the title bars of small windows, such as tool windows.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used to display text in the status bar.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that is used to display text in the status bar.
